title: Authors and Citation
text: Ishida M (2024). TreeRingShape: Recording tree-ring shapes tree disks using manual digitizing interpolating model. R package version 1.0.0.9000,       https://ishidamgm.github.io/TreeRingShape/,     https://www.sanchikanri.com/treering/TreeRingShape.html, https://github.com/ishidamgm/TreeRingShape.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TreeRingShape: Recording tree-ring shapes of tree disks using manual digitizing and interpolating model},   author = {Megumi Ishida},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0.9000,       https://ishidamgm.github.io/TreeRingShape/,     https://www.sanchikanri.com/treering/TreeRingShape.html},   url = {https://github.com/ishidamgm/TreeRingShape}, }

what: Recording tree-ring shapes of tree disks using manual digitizing and interpolating model
title: Recording tree-ring shapes of tree disks using manual digitizing and interpolating model
text: R package designed efficiently recording shape annual rings tree trunk cross-section. interpolates annual rings (L2) representative annual ring lines (L) annual ring points (P) representative annual ring lines inputted radii measured GIS software (Qgis). “representative annual ring” refers annual rings characterize shape outer circumference cross-section disc, requiring fewer rings closer shape perfect circle. Although annual rings grow concentrically around pith, shape perfectly circular. Traditionally, dendrochronology tree-ring analysis evaluated tree growth based width annual rings. However, advancement image analysis technologies, increasing number studies evaluating growth based area annual rings. studies focused conifer plantation samples, annual rings clearly defined. However, package also enables recording annual ring shapes trees natural forests, ring shapes complex. noted, however, currently, information regarding shape annual rings needs manually inputted, can labor-intensive. ** see also ** https://www.sanchikanri.com/treering/TreeRingShape.html

title: Calculate tree ring index from chronosequence data (year,growth) — TreeRingIndex
code: if (FALSE) { ya <- plot_year_RingArea(TR@L2, 2018)$Year_TreeRingArea plot(ya,type='b') tri. <- TreeRingIndex(ya) lines(tri.$spline,col='red',lw=2) plot(tri.$idx,type='b') abline(h=1,col='red') }

title: Interpolates tree ring between representative (manual input) tree rings with tree ring points — TreeRingsInterpolation
code: slotNames(TR) #>  [1] "P_filename"  "P_id.tag"    "P_ring.tag"  "P"           "P00"         #>  [6] "n_id"        "YR_P"        "L_filename"  "L_ring.tag"  "L"           #> [11] "L_"          "YR_L"        "ln"          "L2_filename" "L2"          #> [16] "n_YR"        # help("classTreeRingShape-class",package="TreeRingShape") TR <- TreeRingsInterpolation(TR)                                                                      ya <- plot_year_RingArea(TR@L2, 2018)$Year_TreeRingArea   plot(ya,type='b') tri. <- TreeRingIndex(ya) lines(tri.$spline,col='red',lw=2)  plot(tri.$idx,type='b') abline(h=1,col='red')

class of TreeRingShape — classTreeRingShape-class
text: class TreeRingShape

title: class of TreeRingShape — classTreeRingShape-class
text: P_filename character. file name shape file (P) tree ring points P_id.tag character.   column name id shape file (P), default 'id' P_ring.tag character. column name ring .(ordinaly year,outermost=0) shape file (P), default 'ring' P data.frame.         radial tree ring points (x,y,id,yr,r,deg) P00 numeric.          x,y coordinates c(px00,py00) tree ring center point, ordinarily pith disk, point id==0 P n_id numeric.         number radial measurement points, length(unique(P$id))-1  (omit original point id=0) YR_P numeric.         total number tree rings, unique(P$ring) L_filename character. file name shape file (L) tree ring lines L_ring.tag character. column name ring .(ordinaly year,outermost=0) shape file (L), default 'ring' L list.               x,y coordinates representative tree rings L_ data.frame.        x,y coordinates representative tree rings YR_L numeric.         cumulative tree rings number(year) 0 (cambium layer) L =dbf$ring, names(L) ln numeric.           total number  representative tree rings,  length(L) L2_filename character. file name shape file (L2) tree ring lines interpolated L2 list.              x,y coordinates representative + interpolated tree rings n_YR numeric.        total number representative + interpolated tree rings  = unique(P$yr), length(L2)
